intro: Krausella forbesii, commonly known as the Forbes' krausella, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
